testCases.comments: It does validate mobile number based on country code , and check if mobile number is register or not , if mobile number is register than it tell that number is already register
testCases.testSteps:
1. Go to Sign Up Page.
2. Enter valid mobile number
3. Tap Continue.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify valid mobile number accepted

testCases.comments: it validate mobile number based on country so in invalid format digtis are missing , so if customer enter enough digit that consider as mobile number it redirect on otp page , but because number is not exists , user can not proceed further
testCases.testSteps:
1. Go to Sign Up Page.
2. Enter invalid mobile number
3. Tap Continue.
testCases.testCaseDescription: verify invlaid number

testCases.testSteps:
1. Enter correct OTP.
2. Tap Verify.
testCases.expectedResult: Redirect to Name, Last Name,Email page.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify correct OTP works

testCases.testSteps:
1. Enter invalid OTP.
2. Tap Verify.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify invalid OTP rejected

testCases.testSteps:
1. Enter OTP after expiry (2+ mins).
2. Tap Verify.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify expired OTP rejected

testCases.testSteps:
1. Tap Resend OTP.
2. Check new OTP received.
3. Enter new OTP.
4. Tap Verify.
testCases.expectedResult: New OTP is valid and accepted.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify resend OTP button works

testCases.testSteps:
1. Leave Name empty.
2. Fill Last Name & Email.
3. Tap Continue.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify empty Name not allowed

testCases.testSteps:
1. Enter Name.
2. Leave Last Name empty.
3. Fill Mobile.
4. Tap Continue.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify empty Last Name not allowed

testCases.testSteps:
1. Enter Name & Last Name.
2. Leave Mobile empty.
3. Tap Continue.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify empty Mobile not allowed

testCases.testSteps:
1. Enter valid Name & Last Name
2. Enter valid Mobile.
3. Tap Continue.
testCases.expectedResult: User successfully registered & redirected to Home Page.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify valid Mobile number accepted

testCases.testSteps:
1. Enter valid Name & Last Name.
2. Enter invalid Mobile (letters or <10 digits).
3. Tap Continue.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify invalid Mobile number rejected

testCases.testSteps: 1. Click on Profile Icon (top-right). 2. Click on Change Location. 3. Enter valid location in search field. 4. Select location from suggestions. 5. Click Continue.
testCases.expectedResult: Entered location should be set successfully and displayed as selected location.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify location can be set manually

testCases.testSteps: 1. Click on Profile Icon. 2. Navigate to Change Location. 3. Click on Use Current Location. 4. Click Continue.
testCases.expectedResult: Current GPS location should be detected and set as selected location.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify "Use Current Location" sets GPS location

testCases.testSteps: 1. Click on Profile Icon (top-right). 2. Click on Change Location. 3. Enter valid location in search field. 4. Select location from suggestions. 5. Click Continue.
testCases.expectedResult: Entered location should be set successfully and displayed as selected location.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify location can be set manually

testCases.testSteps: 1. Click on Profile Icon. 2. Navigate to Change Location. 3. Click on Use Current Location. 4. Click Continue.
testCases.expectedResult: Current GPS location is detected and set successfully.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify “Use My Current Location” when GPS is ON & permission granted

testCases.testSteps: 1. Click on Profile Icon. 2. Go to Change Location. 3. Click on Use Current Location.
testCases.actualResult: Currently directly asks user to turn on navigation → no intermediate error shown.
testCases.expectedResult: App should prompt user to Turn ON GPS/Location Services.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify “Use My Current Location” when GPS is OFF

testCases.testSteps: 1. Set location using Use Current Location. 2. Close app. 3. Reopen app.
testCases.expectedResult: Last selected location should persist as current location.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify persistence of selected location after using current location

testCases.testSteps: 1. Open Profile menu.2. Click My Reservation.
testCases.actualResult: Empty scrren display with Message "no reservation made"
testCases.expectedResult: Page should show empty state message (not error message).
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify empty state when no restaurant is reserved

testCases.testSteps: 1. Book a restaurant.2. Open My Reservation.
testCases.expectedResult: Reserved restaurant should be listed with correct details.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify restaurant booking is displayed in reservation list

testCases.testSteps: 1. Open My Reservation.2. Check displayed restaurant.
testCases.expectedResult: Restaurant name matches the one booked.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify correct restaurant name is displayed

testCases.testSteps: 1. Open My Reservation.2. Verify address, date/time, guests.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify correct restaurant details are displayed

testCases.testSteps: 1. Open My Reservation.
testCases.expectedResult: Status shows Pending by default after booking.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify reservation status shows correctly (Pending)

testCases.testSteps: 1. Open My Reservation.2. Click Call button.
testCases.expectedResult: Phone dialer opens with restaurant contact number.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify Call button functionality

testCases.testSteps: 1. Open My Reservation.2. Click Navigation button.
testCases.actualResult: Works as expected and click on get direction navigate on map app for get direction
testCases.expectedResult: Map/navigation app opens with correct restaurant location.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify Navigation button functionality

testCases.testSteps: 1. Book 2+ restaurants.2. Open My Reservation.
testCases.expectedResult: All reserved restaurants should be listed with correct details.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify multiple reservations are listed

testCases.testSteps:
1. Use scanner option from home page , or from profile click on top right corner icon to access scanner
2.scan the Restaurant QR code
testCases.actualResult: After Scanning QR code , it redirect on right Restaurant and display table number
testCases.expectedResult: based on QR code navigate on correct restaurant
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify the Scanner to redirect on correct restaurant

testCases.testSteps: 1. Go to Edit Profile.2. Clear First Name field.3. Click Save.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify that first name cannot be empty

testCases.testSteps: 1. Go to Edit Profile.2. Clear Last Name field.3. Click Save.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify that last name cannot be empty

testCases.testSteps: 1. Go to Edit Profile.2. Clear Mobile Number field.3. Click Save.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify that mobile number cannot be empty

testCases.testSteps: 1. Go to Edit Profile.2. Select country code "+1".3. Enter valid US number.4. Click Save.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify valid mobile number for country code +1 (US)

testCases.testSteps: 1. Go to Edit Profile.2. Select country code "+1".3. Enter invalid US number.4. Click Save.
testCases.actualResult: Show error: "Invalid number for selected country."
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify invalid mobile number for country code +1 (US)

testCases.testSteps: 1. Go to Edit Profile.2. Select country code "+91".3. Enter valid Indian number.4. Click Save.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify valid mobile number for country code +91 (India)

testCases.testSteps: 1. Go to Edit Profile.2. Select country code "+91".3. Enter invalid Indian number.4. Click Save.
testCases.actualResult: Show error: "Invalid number for selected country."
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify invalid mobile number for country code +91 (India)

testCases.testSteps: 1. Go to Edit Profile.2. Select country code "+44".3. Enter valid UK number.4. Click Save.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify valid mobile number for country code +44 (UK)

testCases.testSteps: 1. Go to Edit Profile.2. Select country code "+44".3. Enter invalid UK number.4. Click Save.
testCases.actualResult: Show error: "Invalid number for selected country."
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify invalid mobile number for country code +44 (UK)

testCases.testSteps: 1. Go to Edit Profile.2. Select different country codes.3. Enter valid numbers for each.4. Click Save.
testCases.actualResult: Save successful for each country code.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify valid number works for multiple countries

testCases.testSteps: 1. Go to Edit Profile.2. Select different country codes.3. Enter invalid numbers.4. Click Save.
testCases.actualResult: Show error for each country code.
testCases.testCaseDescription: Verify invalid number shows error for multiple countries

testCases.testSteps:
1. Launch the Foodchow Customer app from a fresh installation state (or after clearing app data).
  2. Observe the app presenting a prompt to select a location or grant location permission.
  3. Instead of selecting a location or granting permission, use the device's back button or an equivalent dismiss action to skip the location prompt.
  4. Attempt to navigate to the Login screen or any other core application functionality (e.g., by tapping on a 'Login' button if present, or trying to access main navigation).
testCases.actualResult: User can skip the process using back navigation and use different login method
testCases.testScenario: Verify app prevents user from proceeding without location selection after skipping initial prompt.
testCases.preConditions:
• Foodchow Customer app is installed on a mobile device.
  • The app's data is cleared (fresh installation state).
  • Device has an active internet connection.
testCases.expectedResult: The app should prevent the user from proceeding to the Login screen or any other core functionality. It should either persistently display the location selection/permission prompt, show an error message, or restrict navigation until a location is provided.
testCases.testCaseDescription: This test case verifies that when a user launches a fresh installation of the Foodchow Customer app and skips the initial location selection or permission prompt (e.g., by using the device's back button), the app prevents the user from navigating to the login screen or any other primary functionality until a location is explicitly provided.

testCases.testSteps:
1. Launch the Foodchow Customer app.
  2. Navigate to the section requiring location input (e.g., home screen, search page).
  3. Locate the 'Use current location' button/option.
  4. Rapidly tap the 'Use current location' button multiple times (e.g., 3-5 times within 2 seconds).
  5. Observe the number of times the location selection/display page opens or refreshes.
testCases.actualResult: When user click on Use current Location button multiple times , page open as many time as user click  ,and in IOS loading bar is not appear
testCases.testScenario: Verify multiple taps on 'Use current location' do not open multiple location pages.
testCases.preConditions:
• Foodchow Customer app is installed and launched.
  • User is on a screen where location input/selection is required.
  • Device Location services are enabled.
  • Foodchow app has necessary location permissions granted.
testCases.expectedResult: The app should navigate to or refresh the location selection page only once, regardless of how many times the 'Use current location' button was rapidly tapped. No multiple or duplicate instances of the location page should open.
testCases.testCaseDescription: This test case validates that when a user rapidly taps the 'Use current location' button in the Foodchow Customer app, it should only navigate to or refresh the location selection page once, preventing multiple page instances from opening simultaneously.

bugs.title: Location Selection Bypass Blocks Regional Login
bugs.description: The Foodchow Customer app allows users to bypass the initial location selection prompt (e.g., by pressing the back button). This prevents the app from displaying region-specific login methods, making it impossible for users to log in with options tied to their region. Location selection should be mandatory to proceed.
bugs.actualResult: User can skip location selection  , so app allow user to login with different method
bugs.expectedResult: User can not use login method that is not support in that region
bugs.stepsToReproduce: in Foodchow Customer app there is a feature that display login method based on Region , and when app open it first ask location and if user skip that part user did not login with method that use for that region , so need to when app open user can not process further without selecting an location steps is Open new fresh app -> when it ask for location permission just click on back button to avoid -> login

bugs.title: Rapid Tapping 'Use Current Location' Button Opens Duplicate Location Pages
bugs.description: When a user rapidly taps the 'Use current location' button, the application incorrectly opens multiple, duplicate instances of the location selection page instead of navigating to or refreshing it only once. This leads to a cluttered user interface and poor experience. Additionally, the loading bar is not displayed on iOS during this operation.
bugs.actualResult: When a user rapidly taps the 'Use current location' button, the application incorrectly opens multiple, duplicate instances of the location selection page instead of navigating to or refreshing it only once.
bugs.expectedResult: User click on "use current lcoation " button and only 1 page open  , even user click on Button multiple times
bugs.stepsToReproduce: Foodchow Customer App → Location module → click on Use current location

testCases.module: Foodchow POS - Tax Settings & Order Management
testCases.comments:
Bug Summary: Foodchow POS: Multiple exclusive taxes applied globally are not consistently displayed for all items in the cart.

Detailed Description: When two exclusive taxes (e.g., Tax1 at 5% and Tax2 at 10%) are configured in 'Tax Settings' as 'Exclusive' and then globally applied to 'all items', a discrepancy occurs in how these taxes are displayed within the cart:
  • Upon adding the first item to the cart, only one of the two globally applied taxes (e.g., Tax1) is displayed for that item, even though both should apply.
  • Upon adding the second item to the cart, both Tax1 and Tax2 are correctly displayed for this second item.
  • However, the first item, which was added previously, does not update; it still only displays one tax (e.g., Tax1), failing to show both Tax1 and Tax2.
This issue indicates that the tax application logic or the cart display rendering does not consistently retrieve and display all globally applied taxes for items already present in the cart, leading to incorrect tax calculations and display for certain items.
testCases.testData:
Tax 1 Details: Name: 'Tax1', Percentage: '5%', Type: 'Exclusive'
Tax 2 Details: Name: 'Tax2', Percentage: '10%', Type: 'Exclusive'
At least two distinct menu items available for order.
testCases.testSteps:
1. Navigate to 'Foodchow Pos' -> 'Tax Settings'.
  2. Click on 'Add Multiple Tax'.
  3. Add the first tax:
    • Select a name (e.g., 'Tax1').
    • Enter a percentage (e.g., '5%').
    • Select 'Exclusive' type.
    • Click 'Add'.
  4. Add the second tax:
    • Ensure the 'Add tax' option is available.
    • Select a name (e.g., 'Tax2').
    • Enter a percentage (e.g., '10%').
    • Select 'Exclusive' type.
    • Click 'Add'.
  5. On the 'Add Multiple Tax' screen, click on 'Both Apply tax 1 by 1' to enable applying both created taxes.
  6. Click on 'Apply tax on all item' to ensure both Tax1 and Tax2 are globally applied to all menu items.
  7. Navigate back to 'Foodchow Pos' home.
  8. Start a new order (e.g., 'start order').
  9. Perform 'Sync data' to ensure the latest tax settings are loaded.
  10. Navigate back to the menu.
  11. From any category, select the first item and add it to the cart.
  12. Check the tax details displayed for the first item in the cart.
  13. From the same or a different category, select a second item and add it to the cart.
  14. Check the tax details displayed for both the first and second items in the cart.
testCases.actualResult:
When two exclusive taxes (e.g., Tax1 at 5% and Tax2 at 10%) are configured in 'Tax Settings' as 'Exclusive' and then globally applied to 'all items',
 Upon adding the first item that listen ,  to the cart, only one of the two globally applied taxes (e.g., Tax1) is displayed for that item, even though both should apply.
Upon adding the second  listed item in the same category to the cart, both Tax1 and Tax2 are correctly Applied for this second item.
However, the first item, which was added previously, does not update; it still only Apply one tax (e.g., Tax1), failing to Apply both Tax1 and Tax2.
testCases.testScenario: Verify consistent application and display of multiple exclusive taxes on all items in the cart.
testCases.preConditions:
• Foodchow POS application (Android/Desktop) is installed and running.
  • User is logged in as an administrator or a role with permissions to manage tax settings and create orders.
  • No existing custom taxes are configured or applied globally prior to this test.
  • At least two different menu items are available in different categories.
testCases.expectedResult: When both the first and second items are added to the cart, the cart details for *both* items should correctly display *both* Tax1 (5% exclusive) and Tax2 (10% exclusive) applied to their respective prices. The total amount for each item should accurately reflect its base price plus both exclusive taxes.
testCases.testCaseDescription: This test case aims to verify that when multiple exclusive taxes are configured and globally applied to all items, both taxes are consistently displayed for every item added to the cart, irrespective of the order in which items are added.

bugs.title: Inconsistent Tax Application for First Item with Multiple Exclusive Global Taxes
bugs.description:
When two exclusive taxes (e.g., Tax1 at 5% and Tax2 at 10%) are configured in 'Tax Settings' as 'Exclusive' and then globally applied to 'all items',
 Upon adding the first item that listen ,  to the cart, only one of the two globally applied taxes (e.g., Tax1) is displayed for that item, even though both should apply.
Upon adding the second  listed item in the same category to the cart, both Tax1 and Tax2 are correctly Applied for this second item.
However, the first item, which was added previously, does not update; it still only Apply one tax (e.g., Tax1), failing to Apply both Tax1 and Tax2.
bugs.actualResult: When the first item is added to the cart, only one of the two globally applied exclusive taxes (e.g., Tax1) is displayed for it. When a second item is added to the cart, both exclusive taxes (e.g., Tax1 and Tax2) are correctly applied to the second item. The first item does not update; it continues to display only one tax (e.g., Tax1), failing to apply both Tax1 and Tax2.
bugs.expectedResult: Upon adding any item to the cart, all globally configured exclusive taxes (e.g., Tax1 and Tax2) should be applied and displayed correctly for that item. All items in the cart should consistently display and calculate all applicable taxes.
bugs.stepsToReproduce:
1. Navigate to 'Tax Settings'.
  2. Configure two exclusive taxes (e.g., 'Tax1' at 5% and 'Tax2' at 10%) and ensure their configuration is set to 'Exclusive'.
  3. Globally apply these configured exclusive taxes to 'all items'.
  4. Add a first item to the shopping cart.
  5. Observe the taxes applied to the first item.
  6. Add a second item (e.g., from the same category or any other item) to the shopping cart.
  7. Observe the taxes applied to the second item, and re-examine the first item in the cart.
